Articles.Content: My queen overheats, obscuring the board with a smokescreen. My bishop attacks your rook from out of the murk.

I remove my entire lineup and replace the monarch with a democracy.

My president sets up affordable health care for all my pawns.

22 hours ago, AlextheBodacious said:

I remove my entire lineup and replace the monarch with a democracy.

My president sets up affordable health care for all my pawns.

So glad you did this! >:)

Pawnald Trump is elected as the new president. He repeals the healthcare bill, starts a bishop registration program, and builds a wall to stop pieces from coming to his side of the board.

Aaaaaaaand that's the maximum-politics-allowed-without-starting-a-flamewar-or-getting-locked limit reached!

1 hour ago, quasarrgames said:

Aaaaaaaand that's the maximum-politics-allowed-without-starting-a-flamewar-or-getting-locked limit reached!

No one said you had to keep it modern-day. Flamewars won't arise if you don't mention anything biased, like names or policies.

The government is overthrown by the people to build a new one. I move my bishop near the capital, and destroy the new government, as well as the orange team's units.

Edited February 29, 2016 by legoclone09
I move my Rook from C1 to C-4.
I move my Cook to C-4, and apply salt and pepper to your Rook.
I move my Pokemon trainer to C-5 and challenge your cook to a battle!
I shoot a portal gun under the floor beneath you, and then shoot my turret to your location.
I throw the board away and place down a pool table. I move my pawn to the white ball.
I move my football huddle to the white ball. Break!
Queen's rook in the corner pocket.
My catcher catches the Queen's rook and throws him to third base to try and get your runner out.

My triad gang friends smuggle a nuke to your game, and liam neeson kills them all looking for his kid.

The umpire says you struck out

But then the Empire Strikes Back! With an orbital turbolaser strike to your king's pawn!

Edited March 7, 2016 by StrandedonEarth
Luckily, Metro Man only faked his death. He's still alive, and he attempts to fix your evil regime.

But gets banned for match fixing.

Speaking of band, I get past Through The Fire And The Flames on Expert.

Edited March 8, 2016 by cantab

I use a Spitfire with infinite ammo turned on to drop a chain of 500lb bombs across the centre of the board. Pieces go flying everywhere. 

(I used to have so much fun with CFS3)
Easy Anti-Cheat catches you for cheating and the damage is reversed. I can then build my base without interruption, and start upgrading my walls to Armored tier.
My queenside bishop summons Doomtrain, stripping your walls of their armour stat and leaving your pieces exposed. And blind, mute, confused, and poisoned if I remember rightly too.
My king's bishop casts "Tiltowait," which creates a small nuclear explosion in the path of your Doomtrain/
We are at DEFCON 1. I launch all my nuclear missiles at the opposing side.

Thankfully I researched all 8 military technologies, and have my missile shield activated. Your nukes detonate and destroy quite a bit of my nation, but I have the resources to quickly rebuild and the Armageddon clock isn't down all the way.

I build a huge army of tanks and infantry and start sending them to capture territory.
I issue a series of POKE commands that set the health on those tanks and infantry to zero. One more POKE teleports my knight to check your king.
My king sends out the dogs of war, which nip at your knight's hooves until the horse throws its rider
